module.description: Master slave Multichannel Serial Port Interface

register.description: This register contains the hard coded RTL revision number

bitfield.description: IP revision [7:4] Major revision [3:0] Minor revision

register.description: This register allows controlling various parameters of the OCP interface. It is not sensitive to soft reset.

bitfield.description: Clocks activity during wake up mode period

bitenum.description: OCP and Functional clocks may be switched off
OCP clock is maintained. Functional clock may be switched-off
Functional clock is maintained. OCP clock may be switched-off
OCP and Functional clocks are maintained

If an idle request is detected, the McSPI acknowledges it unconditionally and goes in Inactive mode. Interrupt, DMA requests and wake up lines are unconditionally de-asserted and the module wakeup capability is deactivated even if the bit MCSPI_SYSCONFIG[EnaWakeUp] is set
If an idle request is detected, the request is ignored and the module does not switch to wake up mode, and keeps on behaving normally

Smart-idle mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. IP module shall not generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events
IP module may generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events when in idle state. Mode is only relevant if the appropriate IP module "swakeup" output(s) is (are) implemented

bitfield.description: Software reset. During reads it always returns 0.

bitenum.description: Set this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset.The bit is automatically reset by the hardware
Automatic OCP clock gating strategy is applied, based on the OCP interface activity

register.description: This register provides status information about the module excluding the interrupt status information
The interrupt status regroups all the status of the module internal events that can generate an interrupt

bitfield.description: Receiver register is full or almost full. Only when Channel 3 is enabled

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Transmitter register underflow. Only when Channel 3 is enabled.

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Transmitter register is empty or almost empty.

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Receiver register full or almost full. Channel 2

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending
w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Transmitter register empty or almost empty. Channel 2

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Receiver register full or almost full. Channel 1

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending
w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Transmitter register empty or almost empty. Channel 1

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Receiver register overflow (slave mode only). Channel 0

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Receiver register full or almost full. Channel 0

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending
w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

bitfield.description: Transmitter register empty or almost empty.Channel 0

bitenum.description: w:Event status bit is reset ,r: Event is pending

register.description: The interrupt status regroups all the status of the module internal events that can generate an interrupt

bitfield.description: End of word count event when a channel is enabled using the FIFO buffer and the channel had sent the number of SPI word defined by MCSPI_XFERLEVEL[WCNT].

register.description: This register allows to enable/disable the module internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Receiver register Full or almost full Interrupt Enable. Ch 3
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Ch 3
Transmitter register Empty or almost empty Interrupt Enable. Ch3
Receiver register Full or almost full Interrupt Enable. Ch 2
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Ch 2
Transmitter register Empty or almost empty Interrupt Enable. Ch 2
Receiver register Full or almost full Interrupt Enable. Ch 1
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Ch 1
Transmitter register Empty or almost empty Interrupt Enable. Ch 1
Receiver register Overflow Interrupt Enable. Ch 0
Receiver register Full or almost full Interrupt Enable. Ch 0
Transmitter register Underflow Interrupt Enable. Ch 0
Transmitter register Empty or almost empty Interrupt Enable. Ch 0

register.description: This register allows to enable/disable the module internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: End of Word count Interrupt Enable

register.description: The wakeup enable register allows to enable/disable the module internal sources of wakeup on event-by-event basis.
This register is dedicated to the configuration of the serial port interface.

bitenum.description: FIFO data managed by MCSPI_TX(i) and MCSPI_RX(i) registers
FIFO data managed by MCSPI_DAFTX and MCSPI_DAFRX registers
Multiple word access enabled with FIFO

bitfield.description: Initial spi delay for first transfer

bitenum.description: No delay for first spi transfer.
The controller wait 4 spi bus clock
The controller wait 8 spi bus clock
The controller wait 16 spi bus clock
The controller wait 32 spi bus clock
Master - The module generates the SPICLK and SPIEN[3:0]
Slave - The module receives the SPICLK and SPIEN[3:0]

bitfield.description: Single channel / Multi Channel (master mode only)

bitenum.description: More than one channel will be used in master mode
Only one channel will be used in master mode. This bit must be set in Force SPIEN mode

register.description: This register is dedicated to the configuration of the channel 0

bitenum.description: SPIEN is held high during the active state
SPIEN is held low during the active state
SPICLK is held high during the active state
SPICLK is held low during the active state
Data are latched on odd numbered edges of SPICLK.
Data are latched on even numbered edges of SPICLK.

register.description: This register is dedicated to the configuration of the channel 0

bitenum.description: Clock granularity of power of two
The buffer is not used to receive data.
The buffer is used to receive data
The buffer is not used to transmit data
The buffer is used to transmit data.
Star bit polarity is held to 0 during SPI transfer.
Star bit polarity is held to 1 during SPI transfer

bitfield.description: Start bit enable for SPI transfer

bitenum.description: Default SPI transfer length as specified by WL bit field
Start bit D/CX added before SPI transfer, polarity is defined by MCSPI_CH(i)CONF[SBPOL]

bitfield.description: Channel 0 only and slave mode only: SPI slave select signal detection
Manual SPIEN assertion to keep SPIEN active between SPI words

bitenum.description: Writing 0 into this bit drives low the SPIEN line when MCSPI_CHCONF(i)[EPOL]=0, and drives it high when MCSPI_CHCONF(i)[EPOL]=1
Writing 1 into this bit drives high the SPIEN line when MCSPI_CHCONF(i)[EPOL]=0, and drives it low when MCSPI_CHCONF(i)[EPOL]=1
Turbo is deactivated (recommended for single SPI word transfer)
Turbo is activated to maximize the throughput for multi SPI words transfer

register.description: This register provides status information about transmitter and receiver registers of channel 0

bitenum.description: FIFO Receive Buffer is not full
FIFO Receive Buffer is not empty
FIFO Transmit Buffer is not full
FIFO Tramsmit Buffer is not empty
Shift register is loaded with the data from the transmitter register

register.description: This register is dedicated to enable the channel and defines the extended clock ratio with one clock cycle granularity
This register contains a single SPI word to transmit on the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word to transmit on the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word received through the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register contains a single SPI word received through the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.
This register is dedicated to the configuration of the channel 1

bitenum.description: SPIEN is held high during the active state
SPIEN is held low during the active state
SPICLK is held high during the active state
SPICLK is held low during the active state
Data are latched on odd numbered edges of SPICLK.
Data are latched on even numbered edges of SPICLK.

bitfield.description: Channel 3 FIFO Receive Buffer Full Status

bitenum.description: FIFO Receive Buffer is not full

bitfield.description: Channel 3 FIFO Receive Buffer Empty Status

bitenum.description: FIFO Receive Buffer is not empty

bitfield.description: Channel 3 FIFO Transmit Buffer Full Status

bitenum.description: FIFO Transmit Buffer is not full

This register contains a single SPI word to transmit on the serial link, what ever SPI word length is.

This register contains the SPI words to transmit on the serial link when FIFO used and DMA address is aligned on 256 bit

bitfield.description: FIFO Data to transmit with DMA 256 bit aligned address
